Fill me in, sometime!
thanks, Isaac! BTW, SELF looks really great...
you'll stay right there :) Great video!
Many thanks! Glad to hear you survived the flight :).
Absolutely! Let me know when you find out about @netsquared
@isaacholeman Best of luck, guys
Partnerships and big plans - I'll update you as soon as I'm done packing for Malawi :)
maize for food, tobacco for money
so true. @magchen, look at the little web we've created
wireless is shaky, at best (usually cuts off at 7PM, comes on at 8AM) - but I have the HBC office keys to get to ethernet.
gchat? ;)
@danielbachhuber - Thanks for the note, guys. Bit of a rush to Malawi, but I'll get back to you then. Really exciting stuff!
Thanks! (If there's a show, it's certainly not mine)
@danielbachhuber Good work, guys!
Smoking ARVs? Really, though? http://tinyurl.com/5tv5bu
trying to maximize the minimum gain
Psychological egoism saying an ocean liner constantly consumes coal on its passage, therefore the purpose of the voyage is to consume coal
Rt @mobileactive So if Whiskey ads can be mobilally interactive, why not Planned Parenthood? @magchen, get on it http://snurl.com/7ps12
"Needless loss of more than 1 billion I.Q. points around the world." http://www.nytimes.com/2008/12/04/opinion/04kristof.html
Rt @kiwanja FrontlineSMS in the field. Attach modem. Insert SIM. Install driver. Add contact. Set autoreply. Message in, message out. Easy.
Listening to @kiwanja on SHIFT Radio on citizen journalism, @frontlinesms, mobile-based activism http://tinyurl.com/5mcyey
good folks at the Mulago Foundation
Spoken word at Berkeley. I'm exhausted, and I was just listening.
http://mobilesinmalawi.blogspot.com 30-second clip of Verona, Dickson, and Alex
Mobiles in Malawi blog is back up and running mobilesinmalawi.blogspot.com - Inspired by CNN's article and my upcoming return to Namitete
CNN - "Text service provides more than a Band-Aid for rural health service" http://tinyurl.com/6q243e ... Never expected this!
"Critical Issues in Int'l Women's Health" class vote: $4,000 of $5,000 goes to FORGE projects www.forgenow.org
Exciting new Grassroots Soccer social franchising initiative http://f4hivfree.org/learn/index.html Thinking about Malawi and VCT tournaments
After today, I'm intensely optimistic
Meeting with Nathan Wolfe, founder of GVFI soon. @frontlinesms (#FrontlineMMS) + CellScope for viral forecasting? http://gvfi.org/index.html
Always a pleasure, @kiwanja
Rt @frontlinesms "The Cellphone That Could Change the World" post on Change.org. Well worth a read. http://tinyurl.com/9njhhb
back after an afternoon planting maize and discussing traditional treatment for being plotted against
Malawian nursing program: 29 students, 2 laptops - other 27 pass around mobiles to browse, do research for 20-page papers.
Very curious to see what happens to communication rates once G24i solar panels are distributed www.g24i.com
80% of CHWs who have communicated least (in the bottom 1/4) have network issues
looking forward to a long morning/afternoon examining @frontlinesms and its interaction with CHWs for the last 4 months
Back from a beautiful wedding ceremony in Nami Ntondo. Put on my blogging hat, for a few minutes.
JNB-->Lilongwe flight... Without fail, if you speak to the person sitting next to you, you'll be offered a place to stay
headed to Williams in early January to speak to a social entrepreneurship class - will anyone be around?
Easy flight, and Johannesburg is green. To St.Gabriel's Hospital tomorrow! (First tweet outside the US.)
Plane to JNB full of small children. Uh oh.
Interview with Discovery Channel News was enjoyable; now packing for Namitete, Malawi... http://mobilesinmalawi.blogspot.com will be updated
